Local Government (Election of Mayors) Order (No. 2) 1998

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, make the following order under section 40 of the Local Government Act 1993 .

7 October 1998

G. S. M. GREEN

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

J. A. BACON

Premier

1. Short title
    This order may be cited as the Local Government (Election of Mayors) Order (No. 2) 1998 .

2. Commencement
    This order takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.

3. Interpretation
    The Acts Interpretation Act 1931 applies to the interpretation of this order as if this order were by-laws.

4. Election of mayors and deputy mayors
        (1) The mayor and deputy mayor of a council specified in column 1 of Schedule 1 are to be elected by the councillors of that council.
        (2) The mayor and deputy mayor of a council specified in column 2 of Schedule 1 are to be elected by the electors of the relevant municipal area.

5. Local Government (Election of Mayors) Order 1998 revoked
    The Local Government (Election of Mayors) Order 1998 is revoked.
